metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7830 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The Resource Timing API incorrectly revealed navigations in cross-origin iframes. This is a same-origin policy violation and could allow for data theft of URLs loaded by users. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 57, Firefox ESR < 52.5, and Thunderbird < 52.5.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7830` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 57.0.1+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-globalmenu - 57.0.1+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 57.0.1+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-testsuite - 57.0.1+build2-0ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

thunderbird - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '57.0.1+build2-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
